data.fullContent: Since the invention of the telescope, three more planets have been discovered in our solar system: Uranus (1781), Neptune (1846) and Pluto (1930). Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006. In addition, our solar system is populated by thousands of small bodies such as asteroids and comets. Most of the asteroids orbit in a region between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter, while the home of comets lies far beyond the orbit of Pluto, in the Oort Cloud.
data.answer: 自从望远镜发明以来，在我们的太阳系又发现了三颗行星：天王星(1781年)、海王星(1846年)和冥王星(1930年)。2006年，冥王星被重新归类为矮行星。此外，我们的太阳系由成千上万的小天体组成，比如小行星和彗星。大多数小行星的轨道位于火星和木星轨道之间的区域，而彗星的家园远在冥王星轨道之外的奥尔特星云中。
